response.raw:
Here is the memo for answering telephones and directing calls:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>
MEMO
To: Medical Office Staff
From: [Your Name], Senior Medical Secretary and Administrative Assistant
Subject: Answering Telephones and Directing Calls
Date: [Current Date]
As the first point of contact for patients and other callers to our medical office, it is critical that we handle all incoming telephone calls in a professional, efficient and courteous manner. Please follow these guidelines when answering calls:
• Answer the phone within 3 rings with a pleasant greeting: "Good morning/afternoon, [Practice Name], this is [Your Name]. How may I assist you?"
• Listen carefully to the caller's request or inquiry. If the call is for a physician or other staff member, politely place the caller on a brief hold and transfer the call to the appropriate extension.
• If the staff member is unavailable, offer to take a detailed message or transfer the call to that person's voicemail. Always ask for the caller's name and phone number in case the call gets disconnected.
• For general inquiries, answer the caller's questions if you are able to do so. If not, transfer the call to someone who can assist them or take a message.
• End each call with a pleasant closing such as "Thank you for calling. Have a great day."
By directing calls efficiently and providing helpful and friendly service, we will ensure our patients and callers have a positive experience when contacting our office. Please let me know if you have any questions.
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
